reviews.sentence: Cool Comfortable. Really cool sleek place. The room facilities were comfortable and modern. do not understand other people complains. The space staff were very adequate. Our one night stand was very satisfyingNo complains.

Hidden Gem in 29th Street. Great location friendly helpful staff. Concierge outstanding. Clean compact room with every amenity and good sized bathroom. I particularly liked the high quality bathroom products. Housekeeping staff could not have been more cooperative. I so enjoyed staying here and I have recommended it to others who also have been pleased with the standard of room and service. The restaurant serves excellent food and the bar has a good atmosphere. The quality of the champagne served was excellent and contributed to my celebration. I look forward to staying at the MW again.
Great experience. Nice option for breakfast drinks food in the lobby restaurant. Room was small but updated and perfectly functional.

Small small small. room was so small maybe 180sqft 2 single beds. what amounts to a bean bag to sit on. bathroom was nice except builders cut corners everywhere. the sprinkler head came out of the ceiling through a hole that looked like it was created by a punch not trimmed out professionally. you could see where the paint brush while painting the wall hit the window frame and no one cared to tidy it up. did i mention how small the room was and the room was small. nice lobby nice restaurant and decent location. but if you plan on doing work at a desk and spending time in the room look elsewhere. if you want a decent local and only a place to drop a few clothes and sleep then okaybut for 320 night I expected better.

Small charming hotel with great restaurant great price. On a tip we reserved a room for a weekend in NYC. Hotel room was small but was immaculate and had wonderful decor. Old World charm meets cool urban chic. Restaurant downstairs was fabulous bar was generous with their pours. Hotel located in nice area with easy walk or subway ride to any borough. We will return.

could not have been more pleased. I could not have been happier. The front desk was very helpful the rooms were immaculate and the lobby was great for spending time with friends in other rooms. The location was great we were on the eighth floor and I was astonished at how quiet the rooms were during the night.

Great Stay. Very nice hotel. Foyer and room very clean and modern. I stayed in the cosey room and yes it is cosey. But I did not mind as I was just looking for a place to sleep. Room was clean and comfortable despite the size. There was a little traffic noise but I guess that s NYC. Modern and clean.

Qucik trip basic accommodations. Hotel provided what we needed I place to change clothes and sleep but not much more. Room was comfortable and clean but amenities was sparse things we have had everywhere else just are not there eg robes slippers ample towels. The restaurant Marta and the staff there is INCREDIBLE.

Qucik trip basic accommodations. Hotel provided what we needed I place to change clothes and sleep but not much more. Room was comfortable and clean but amenities was sparse things we have had everywhere else just are not there eg robes slippers ample towels. The restaurant Marta and the staff there is INCREDIBLE.
Great Hotel. We arrived and they reception was very fast. They upgraded my room to a suite.

Good location hotel could be better. Overall I really enjoyed our one week stay at the Martha Washington Hotel. It was a fantastic location and we walked everywhere. I wish we could have stayed a bit longer as we started to find great things close by to do. it is very close to the Empire State Building The Morgan Library and Museum Madison Square Park and the Flatiron Building. On our last night there we also found a lovely buzy and atmospheric gastro pub type restaurant and bar called Tavern29 just two buildings away. In the hotel itself is the very popular Marta restaurant which was always really busy and had a 1great feel about it. We went there and had the pizza which was okay but not the bestThe room itself was all that we needed it was compact but the bed was really comfy after a long day exploring and even during a summer heatwave it remained cool. Unfortunately there were a few things that could have been better. When you get past the reception area the hotel becomes very dark and gloomy all day long with dark painted walls. I think the hotel has recently been refurbished but to me it looked outdated. This is completely personal though and others may like that. Next to our room was a staff room which mysteriously emanated what looked and smelt like cigarette smoke every day a bit off putting. In the room itself it would have been good to have some kind of tea and coffee making facilities maybe this is not so common in New York. Another problem was that the shower was very leaky and the door did not keep in water meaning it always slightly flooded into the small bathroom. In general it is a good hotel and very functional for a weeks holiday but there are definitely small improvements which would make it better. I will look elsewhere if I stay in New York again.

Really fun place to stay. it is not near any of the main subways except for the 6 so that is kind of a pain but really good and lively restaurant downstairs. Rooms are nice. The only thing is the heat is on. And if you live in NY or in the northeast you know what I am talking about with the radiators and it just cranks out heat. My room has been 75 my entire stay. that is a little hard to sleep in. I stayed on the 12th floor not facing the street and it was a very quiet comfy room. I think they should do something about the heat pumping all of the time and maybe have a dimmer for the hallway lights later at night. it is an older building so the doors have gaps in them and tons of hallways light shines through. Other than that. Great place. Staff went above and beyond. Great time.

Trendy place for younger travellers but mature clients likely to be disappointed. The room was clean and the beds were comfortable. The hotel had recently been refurbished internally and the furnishings and bathrooms were new. The location is central for sights and transit walking. This hotel would better suit 30 somethings than more mature visitors. The room was very small. The public areas and elevators were very noisy with too loud music. There are now additional charges not mentioned in Bokingcom which we managed to avoid because we booked before the hotel changed hands. Otherwise it would have been another 28 per night 12. As it was Taxes charges came to more than 16 of the bill. The restaurant was popular but was very noisy you would struggle to have a conversation poor acoustic design and the noise spills out into reception making conversation at the desk difficult. Breakfast was too expensive for us. The outside is being restored so the front of the building is behind scaffolding on the ground floor. Front desk staff seemed efficient but not particularly friendly.
Very good. The complimentary coffee was fresh delicious and the beds were super comfortable. The hallways smelled like cigarette smoke but the room was fine.

Nice hotel and location but average value. This is a nice hotel in a good location but value for money is not good. The rooms are very small even comparable to others nearby. The facility fee charged when services not provided problems accessing the external gym when they ran out of voucher despite it included in the facility fee and repeated requests to provide the complimentary water were ignored. The hotel agreed not to charge the facility fee in the end. In terms of value for money and good service there are better options nearby. Building Decoration. Great Location on Manhattan. Should provided facilities included in a mandatory fee. Breakfast value for money is the worst I have seen anywhere in any country.

Fair. Not a 4star hotel. Just had surface amenities to check it off the list as a 4star hotel. Room was shabby. Paint patches were on our windows and the rug was cheap and old. The room was more spacious than average but never was done with the space.

Compact central. I have addressed issues with payment and mysterious charges with the hotel and in other reviews. Positives brilliant base for sight seeing. room was clean. massive TVNegatives. no note of room amenities construction noise opposite hotel lighting could be better.

Overall very disappointed with my stay at The Redbury. Had higher expectations. Thank god for Marta ’s restaurant at the hotel. Delicious thin crust pizza and yummy drinks. Always busy though make sure to have reservations. I had submitted a request to the property through bokingscom to cancel my reservation. After they emailed back saying there will be a fee to cancel I decided to keep my reservation. I showed up to the hotel to my reservation having been cancelled. The property pushed through my request as an automatic cancellation. Also I had requested an early check in but when we arrived the system was down. Ended up dealing with a cancellation and late check in which were both very inconvenient and not accommodating. In addition to this I opened the sofa bed in the room to find a very dirty mattress. I have attached a photo. On our last day as we were heading to the elevator I was greeted by a mouse. Much to my surprise I let out a loud yell and the mouse rushed its way to room 715. Thank god this happened on my way out. Imagine the terror if I had seen one in our suite. We have a Redbury in LA which I frequent often. I was expecting so much more from the NYC property. They do n’t even have a normal lobby lounge for the early arriving guests who have to wait hours for their room.

Not as pictured but service was good. For a 45 star hotel I was surprised because it did not live up to the pictures. The beds are not as plush as the photos. Instead it was standard to any 3star hotel. The lobby is beautiful but other than that the room was run down and older than pictured. The bathroom had nice finishes but there was no shower door which caused the water to flow onto the rest of the bathroom. And the windows are not sealed shut so there was a breeze from the bathroom window where I was cold in the bathroom and hot in the room to try to level out the temperature. The staff was really nice. They also have a membership to Equinox so if you are looking for a good workout gym this could be a good fit.
Good. Dark ugly hallways.
